content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Based on my preference for security and certainty, I would choose to play it safe by consistently choosing the same option throughout the game. In this case, let's go with option B. If my anonymous partner chooses the same strategy, we will both earn 12$ per round in 56 out of 75 rounds (as we will both pick B in those rounds). This means I will earn a total of (56*12) + (2*45) = $708. If my partner chooses R, I will lose money in the first 25 rounds, but after that, I'll start earning money again. However, even if they choose R every time, I will still come out ahead because of the initial 45$ from the rounds where we both picked R. So, I choose B {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 42$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

In this situation, if I want to maximize my earnings for the long run based on my preference for security and certainty, I would continue choosing the same option (B) in the hope that my opponent changes their strategy or begins to adapt to mine. By consistently choosing B, I ensure that I earn 42$ every time they choose R, which is more than what I would earn if we both chose R (45$). So, I will continue with my choice of B {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 42$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

Given my opponent's choice of R in the previous round and wanting to maximize my earnings, I will choose option R this time {R}. This way, if my opponent continues to choose R, I will earn 42$ for each round they do so. If, however, my opponent changes their strategy and chooses B, I will switch back to choosing B in the next round to maximize my earnings once again. So, I choose R {R}.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Since both of us chose the same option (R) and received a payoff of 45$, it seems that our strategies are aligned for now. To maintain this alignment and continue earning the maximum possible payoff (45$) in each round, I will choose R again {R}. However, it's important to remember that our opponent could change their strategy at any point, so I should remain flexible and ready to adapt if necessary. So, I choose R {R}.
You chose R. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 0$. Your opponent's payoff is 42$. Please play the next round.

In this situation, since I received a zero payoff for choosing R while my opponent chose B, I want to maximize my earnings going forward by adapting my strategy. Given my preference for security and certainty, I will choose option B in the next round {B}. This way, if my opponent continues with their previous choice (R), I will start earning a payoff again, although it won't be as much as when we both chose R initially. If my opponent changes their strategy to B, then we will both earn 12$ per round. So, I choose B {B}.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 12$. Your opponent's payoff is 12$. Please play the next round.
